question: where does the name loyola university come from
vanilla_rag_result: The name "Loyola University" comes from St. Ignatius of Loyola, who is the founder of the Society of Jesus (Jesuits). The various institutions named "Loyola" are associated with the Jesuit tradition and reflect the influence of St. Ignatius, who established the Jesuit order in 1540. The specific branding rights for "Loyola University" were granted to Loyola University Chicago by the Association of Jesuit Colleges and Universities in 1996, which led to the current trademark for Loyola University New Orleans as "Loyola University New Orleans."
